meanings.definition: To close or fasten (a door, window, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She shuted the door quietly before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: He always shuted the windows tightly before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat shuted the cabinet door, trapping the toy inside.
meanings.sent4: The old house shuted its windows, keeping its secrets hidden from the world.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the door being shuted echoed through the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: To move or put (something) in a particular position by closing or fastening it.
meanings.sent1: She shuted the book on the shelf after finishing it.
meanings.sent2: He shuted the suitcase, ready for his trip.
meanings.sent3: The chef shuted the lid on the pot, letting the soup simmer.
meanings.sent4: The gardener shuted the gate, keeping the rabbits out of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The child shuted the box, excited to open it later.
